title: Aluminum fell to 2,774.55 USD/T on October 17, 2025, down 0.88% from the previous day
summary: Aluminum prices dropped slightly to $2,774.55 per tonne on October 17, 2025, down 0.88% from the previous day. Despite this dip, prices have risen 2.89% over the past month and are up 6.06% compared to the same time last year. Aluminum futures recently hit a three-year high amid tight supply and bullish demand expectations, with forecasts suggesting prices could reach $2,805.80 per tonne by the end of the quarter.

title: Price of Aluminum: Mill Fire Adds Fuel to in U.S. Prices
summary: European aluminum plate prices, particularly the 5083 grade, saw significant increases, rising 3.79% to $4,654 per metric ton as of October 1. The LME primary three-month aluminum prices also rose by 2.61% to $2,678 per metric ton. The article highlights supply disruptions such as mill fires contributing to price volatility in the U.S. aluminum market.

title: Aluminum price heads for longest winning streak in a year
summary: Aluminum prices climbed for a seventh consecutive session ahead of the Federal Reserve's anticipated interest rate decision, reaching the highest levels since March 2025. The metal's gains are supported by expectations of monetary easing, which tends to weaken the dollar and boost industrial metals. Additionally, increased withdrawals from inventories have raised concerns about supply tightness.

title: LME Week US Aluminum Tariff Impact Reshapes Global Markets
summary: The U.S. Section 232 tariffs imposed in June 2025 on aluminum imports, including a 50% tariff, have significantly disrupted global aluminum markets. These tariffs aim to boost domestic production capacity but have caused supply chain recalibrations and market volatility, especially affecting Canadian exports, which historically supplied 70% of U.S. aluminum imports. The tariff impact continues to influence pricing and trade dynamics in the aluminum sector.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices surged to their highest level in three years, reaching around $2,800 per tonne due to rising demand from clean energy sectors and supply constraints. Factors such as China's power shortages limiting smelting output, new environmental regulations, and unrest in Guinea affecting bauxite supply have tightened the market. The metal's role in electric vehicles, solar panels, and renewable power infrastructure is driving demand, with a forecasted 40% increase in aluminum demand by 2030.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices have reached a 3-year high due to increasing demand from electric vehicles, solar, and grid upgrades. The industry is shifting towards low-carbon production, with new projects in Europe, Canada, and the Middle East expected to increase global capacity. Companies like Mercedes-Benz and Volvo are signing long-term contracts for low-carbon aluminum.

title: RMI Introduces New Sustainable Aluminum Finance Framework to Propel Industry Decarbonization
summary: RMI has introduced a Sustainable Aluminum Finance Framework to help banks align financing with decarbonization goals. Aluminum is crucial for electric vehicles and renewable energy infrastructure, and decarbonizing the sector requires switching to clean power sources and increasing recycling rates.

title: 7 Critical Threats Facing the Global Aluminum Industry
summary: The aluminum industry faces challenges such as carbon emission regulations, evolving regulatory frameworks, and rising production costs. Companies must develop strategies to navigate these challenges while maintaining competitiveness and sustainability. The industry's carbon footprint is significant, and decarbonization efforts are underway.

title: Steel prices in the third week of October
summary: Global steel scrap prices dropped to $272/tonne, down $13 from last week, while iron ore prices fell to $102/tonne, down $5. Billet prices ranged between $475–510/tonne, and rebar prices remained stable between $570–620/tonne compared to last week.

title: Steel Price Chart and Market Trends
summary: Steel prices rose slightly to 3,044 CNY/ton on October 17, 2025, up 0.03% from the previous day. However, steel prices have fallen 1.07% over the past month and are down 6.34% compared to last year. Forecasts expect prices to trade around 3,008.71 CNY/ton by the end of the quarter.

title: HRC Steel Price Update and Forecast
summary: Hot Rolled Coil (HRC) steel prices fell to 814 USD/ton on October 17, 2025, down 0.12% from the previous day and down 2.05% over the past month. Despite this, prices remain 15.46% higher than a year ago. Futures indicate a potential price increase to 829.86 USD/ton by the end of the quarter.

title: Raw Steels MMI: Steel Prices Soften, More Tariffs on Deck
summary: U.S. steel prices have been in a slow downtrend since March 2025, falling 9.49% by mid-August. Despite this, prices remain higher than at the start of the year. Futures markets suggest further declines, with mills offering discounts amid soft demand and high supply.

title: US scrap trends outlook: October 2025
summary: Ferrous scrap prices are expected to decline further in October 2025 due to softening demand. Market participants across buyers, brokers, and sellers anticipate weak price performance, with inventories slightly below average and declining mill demand driving the downturn.

title: Steel Market Update: US Scrap and Hot-Rolled Coil Prices
summary: Nucor held its hot-rolled coil spot price steady at $875 per short ton for eight weeks. US scrap prices fell in October for busheling and shredded scrap, while HMS prices remained flat. Demand for steel, including plate products, remains thin with short lead times and mills more willing to negotiate spot prices.

title: Global Steel Demand to Stabilise in 2025 before Recovery in 2026
summary: The World Steel Association projects global steel demand to stabilize at 1.75 billion tonnes in 2025, with a 1.3% rebound expected in 2026. While China's steel demand is softening, growth in India, Vietnam, Egypt, and Saudi Arabia is driving expansion, particularly in infrastructure and manufacturing sectors.

title: CRU: Soft Demand Weighs on Sheet Imports into the US
summary: Brazilian slab export prices remained stable in October amid competition from low-priced Asian offers, with export volumes slightly down month-over-month but up year-over-year. An incident at ArcelorMittal Mexico impacted slab production, potentially increasing reliance on imported slabs to offset shortfalls.

title: BSRM Steel Declares 50% Cash Dividend for FY25
summary: BSRM Steel has recommended a 10% cash dividend to its shareholders for the fiscal year 2025, signaling positive financial performance and shareholder returns.

title: Stainless Steel Maker Mangalam Worldwide Q2 Net Profit Grows to Rs 10.5 Cr
summary: Ahmedabad-based Mangalam Worldwide, an integrated stainless steel player with an annual capacity of 180,000 metric tonnes, reported growth in its Q2 net profit to Rs 10.5 crore, reflecting strong operational performance.

title: Swedish Green Steel Firm Stegra Launches $1B Round to Finish Hydrogen Steel Plant
summary: Stegra, formerly H2 Green Steel, has initiated a €975 million ($1.1 billion) financing round to complete its hydrogen-based green steel plant in Boden, Sweden. The project, one of Europe's flagship industrial decarbonization efforts, has already secured €6.5 billion in funding and is over 60% complete.

title: Weekly Raw Steel Production in the US: Week Ending October 11, 2025
summary: US domestic raw steel production reached 1,722,000 net tons with a capability utilization rate of 76.0%, marking an 8.4% increase compared to the same week last year. Year-to-date production through October 11 is up 2.5% from the previous year, indicating steady growth in steel manufacturing capacity.

title: The Global Steel Industry 2025: At a Pivotal Crossroads
summary: The steel industry is undergoing foundational changes driven by AI integration, automation, and sustainability. Green steel production is gaining momentum as nations push for zero emissions, with AI enhancing efficiency and reducing errors in steel manufacturing.

title: The future of steel sustainability: In conversation with Philippe Aubron, Head of Global Automotive at ArcelorMittal
summary: Philippe Aubron discusses the steel industry's shift toward sustainability and decarbonisation, driven by regulatory and customer demands. ResponsibleSteel supports transparency and continuous improvement in ESG criteria, helping steelmakers demonstrate responsible practices and align with other standards.

title: Iron and steelmaking account for around one-tenth of all CO2 emissions. Here's how they could be greener.
summary: Green iron and steel production can significantly reduce CO2 emissions and industrial pollution, improving community health and creating economic opportunities. Challenges include scaling new technologies and the higher cost of green hydrogen and renewable electricity compared to conventional energy.

title: Swedish Green Steel Firm Stegra Launches $1B Round to Finish Hydrogen Steel Plant
summary: Stegra is raising $1 billion to complete a hydrogen-based steel plant in Sweden, which could serve as a blueprint for low-carbon steel production globally. The project aligns with efforts to reduce the steel sector's CO2 emissions and supports green industrial policies in the EU, Japan, and the U.S.

title: SHS Group Secures $1.8B Financing for Power4Steel, Advancing Germany’s Green Steel Transition
summary: Germany’s SHS–Stahl-Holding-Saar Group secured €1.7 billion ($1.83 billion) to fund the Power4Steel project, aiming to cut CO2 emissions by 55% by 2030 and achieve climate neutrality by 2045. The project uses hydrogen-based production and electric arc furnace technology to transform the Saarland steel industry.

title: Copper Prices Extend Gains Close to Record Highs, Improving Prospects for Zambia and the DRC
summary: Copper prices reached $10,775 per metric ton, the highest since May 2024, driven by a weak dollar and mining disruptions. Analysts are divided on the outlook, with UBS raising its medium-term forecasts due to expected supply tightness, while ING remains cautious, citing the need for stronger Chinese demand to sustain the rally.

title: Copper Prices Fall as Trade Tensions and the US Government Shutdown Weigh
summary: Copper prices dipped slightly as U.S.-China trade tensions and the ongoing U.S. government shutdown dampened market sentiment, though a weaker dollar provided some support. Concerns about Chinese demand growth persist, with some traders reducing positions amid expectations of softer GDP data from China.

title: Copper Price Forecast: Will Prices Hit $12,000 Per Ton in 2025-2026?
summary: Copper is trading near record highs around $10,900 per ton, buoyed by supply disruptions and strong demand from the energy transition sector. Despite recent volatility from potential U.S. tariffs, prices remain elevated due to ongoing operational challenges at major mines in Chile, DRC, and Indonesia.

title: Copper Prices Drift Upward Despite Stock Surplus
summary: U.S. copper producer prices rose sharply, with the Monthly Metals Index up 3.7% month-over-month. Comex copper hit a two-month high above $11,000 per ton in early October, supported by a weaker dollar and bullish fundamentals, even as global economic headwinds temper demand expectations.

title: Copper price back on track for weekly gain as Trump calms trade angst
summary: Copper prices pared losses after U.S. President Trump eased trade war fears with China, putting the metal on track for a weekly gain. Prices had earlier slumped on credit quality concerns but rebounded as Trump announced plans to meet with China's leader, boosting demand prospects.

title: Copper Rises on US Rate Cut Bets
summary: Copper futures climbed back above $5 per pound as dovish remarks from the Federal Reserve reinforced expectations for more US rate cuts, improving the global demand outlook. Supply concerns persisted, with output disruptions in Chile and Indonesia tightening global production, and Codelco reporting its weakest monthly output in over two decades.

title: Copper slips on US credit fears
summary: Copper slid to a one-week low, tracking a fall in global financial stocks as signs of credit stress at US regional banks weighed on market sentiment. The decline reflected broader concerns about credit quality in the US financial sector.

title: Copper price back on track for weekly gain as Trump calms trade angst
summary: Copper pared declines after US President Donald Trump eased fears of a trade war with China, boosting demand prospects for the metal. The wiring metal is on pace for a 0.5% weekly gain, having touched $11,000 a ton the previous week—the highest intraday level since May 2024—on supply concerns.

title: Copper's Golden Decade: Global Market Set to Soar Beyond $450 Billion by 2034
summary: The global copper market is projected to reach USD 456.61 billion by 2034, driven by the green energy transition, electrification, and industrial evolution. Copper demand is expected to increase due to its critical role in renewable energy infrastructure and electric vehicles. Persistent supply constraints are likely to drive upward price pressures.

title: Global Copper Demand Projected to Outpace Supply by Over 500,000 Tonnes In 2025
summary: Copper demand is expected to exceed supply by over 500,000 tonnes in 2025, leading to upward price pressure. The metal is crucial for infrastructure development, renewable energy initiatives, and agricultural modernization. Persistent supply constraints and geopolitical challenges are contributing factors.

title: 100% Recycled Copper Contact Wires
summary: La Farga's innovative technology allows for the full recycling and reuse of copper, significantly reducing environmental impact. This development highlights the growing importance of recycling in the copper industry.

title: LME nickel price maintains upward trend on Oct 19
summary: The three-month futures price of nickel on the London Metal Exchange (LME) rose by US$32/ton on October 19, closing at US$15,684/ton, indicating a short-term upward trend in nickel prices.

title: Nickel Prices Plunge in 2025: Can Demand Revive the Market by 2030?
summary: Nickel prices have been declining steadily, reaching lows not seen since 2020, with early 2025 prices around $15,078 per metric ton. The market faces challenges including oversupply, strong US dollar effects, and slower demand growth, though there is optimism for growth and higher prices by 2030.

title: TRADE REVIEW: Global nickel market eyes oversupply in Q4 as shifting trade policy feeds uncertainty
summary: Nickel ore prices softened in Q3 and are expected to remain weak through Q4 due to narrowing smelter margins and increased imports into China, which have raised inventory levels. Despite government initiatives, the underlying sluggishness in the nickel industry persists, pressuring prices downward.

title: Nickel fell to 15,110 USD/T on October 17, 2025, down 0.79% from the previous day
summary: Nickel prices decreased to $15,110 per tonne on October 17, 2025, marking a 0.79% drop from the previous day and a 1.47% decline over the past month. The price is down 11.02% compared to the same time last year, with expectations for further decline over the next 12 months.

title: On October 19th, the SMM battery-grade nickel sulfate index price was 32113/ton
summary: The battery-grade nickel sulfate index price dropped by 121 yuan/ton on October 19 compared to the previous working day, reflecting a slight decrease in prices for battery-grade nickel products.

title: Vale scraps plans to build Quebec nickel sulphate facility
date: Not specified (latest update as of October 19, 2025)
summary: Vale has abandoned its plans to construct a nickel sulphate facility in Quebec, marking a significant shift in its North American nickel strategy.

title: Alaska Energy Metals Provides Corporate Update On Nikolai Nickel Project, Alaska And Announces Amendment To Restricted Share Plan And Grants Of Stock Options And Restricted Share Units
summary: Alaska Energy Metals provided an update on its Nikolai nickel project, detailing ongoing metallurgical work and plans for a locked-cycle test in November 2025. The company is also pursuing US government grant funding and announced amendments to its share plan.

title: Nornickel cuts 2025 nickel and palladium output forecast due to repairs
date: Not specified (latest update as of October 19, 2025)
summary: Nornickel has reduced its 2025 nickel production forecast to 196,000–204,000 metric tons, citing major repairs and adaptation to new mining equipment. The company also lowered its palladium and copper output forecasts.

title: Nickel at a crossroads: conform or reform
summary: Nth Cycle's modular electro-extraction plant in Ohio began full operations in late 2024, commercializing low-emission nickel and cobalt recovery from scrap. The nickel industry is shifting towards circular recovery to reduce import dependence and environmental damage, with a focus on high-purity, ESG-compliant nickel sourced domestically or from recycling.

title: Top 4 Nickel Companies Driving Electrification and Clean Energy in 2025
summary: BHP is investing billions to expand nickel production capacity and reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 50% at Nickel West by 2030. The company is developing new projects and securing long-term agreements with automakers like Tesla and Toyota to supply sustainable nickel for EV batteries, supporting the transition to a low-carbon future.

title: Stevens Environmental Engineering Researchers are Using Plants to Extract Nickel
summary: Researchers are developing phytomining technology using hyperaccumulator plants to extract nickel from ultramafic mine tailings and soils, offering a cleaner and more sustainable alternative to traditional mining. This approach could help remediate contaminated soils while providing valuable nickel for clean energy technologies.

title: Sofi Prima to Enhance Nickel Sulphate Production at Battery Chemicals Plant
summary: Sofi Filtration delivered its Sofi Prima ultra-sound self-cleaning filtration system to Terrafame's battery chemicals plant in Finland to improve nickel sulphate production purity. The technology reduces contamination, maintenance, and water usage, supporting sustainable and efficient industrial processes in the battery supply chain.

title: PT Vale and PAMA Officially Launch Nickel Mining Project in Kolaka
summary: PT Vale and PAMA have launched a new nickel mining project in Kolaka, prioritizing safety and environmental protection. The project involves collaboration with partners including Huayou and Ford, aiming to support sustainable nickel production for the EV market.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali Enhances Energy Performance and Reduces Environmental Impact
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with CVA to enhance energy performance and reduce environmental impact. This agreement supports the company's decarbonization efforts and aligns with regional sustainability goals. It also benefits CVA by stabilizing energy sale prices and providing economic incentives.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italian Steelmaker Cogne Acciai Speciali Sourcing All Energy from Renewables
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali now sources all its energy from renewable sources in Europe. The company plans to build a hydroelectric plant and an electrolyzer at its Aosta site to produce green hydrogen. This project is part of Italy's National Recovery and Resilience Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali Launches Green Hydrogen Pilot Plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has launched a pilot plant in Aosta, Italy, to produce green hydrogen. This initiative is part of the company's efforts to transition towards cleaner energy sources. The project is supported by the European Union through NextGenerationEU.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris Acquires isOplus Oil and Gas Division in $10M Deal, Expands Pipe Coating Business
summary: Tenaris acquired the oil and gas division of isOplus for $10 million, gaining ownership of pre-insulated pipeline systems for district heating and anti-corrosion coatings in Europe. The acquired business unit is now Tenaris Coating Italy, enhancing Tenaris's offshore market offerings by applying anti-corrosion coatings at facilities in Italy and other countries.

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris hosted a panel in Italy discussing the strategic role of nuclear energy in Europe’s energy transition and Italy’s boilermaking industry future. The company’s Italian mill obtained accreditation to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities, aligning with the highest technical and quality standards, supporting nuclear energy as a key decarbonization driver.

title: Tenaris to present results from material testing for offshore hydrogen transportation at OMC 2025
summary: Tenaris will present findings from a study on fracture toughness of materials exposed to high-pressure hydrogen for offshore pipelines, conducted with IGI Poseidon. The study validates material performance under extreme conditions, supporting the development of safe offshore hydrogen infrastructure, with tests performed on welded pipes at high pressures.

title: Tenaris Completes $600M First Phase of $1.2B Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris completed the first $600 million tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program, repurchasing over 33 million shares representing 3.08% of its capital. The company plans to cancel these treasury shares to reduce share count and potentially increase earnings per share, demonstrating a strong financial position.

title: Tenaris S.A. Reports Shareholder Update on Ownership Stake and Planned Share Sales
summary: Tenaris's controlling shareholders plan to sell some shares while maintaining at least 67% ownership, responding to the company's share repurchase program. This move reflects confidence in the stock and a commitment to long-term investment stability, with sales dependent on market conditions but no plans to reduce ownership below 67%.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded a contract for the construction of a submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia under the Elmed Project. The project aims to create an energy bridge between Europe and Africa, enhancing energy security. The contract could reach a value of around €460 million.

title: Prysmian Secures €460m Contract For Italy–Tunisia Subsea Power Link
summary: Prysmian has secured a contract to build a submarine power cable connecting Italy and Tunisia. The project is valued at approximately €460 million. It will enhance energy connectivity between Europe and Africa.

title: Italy awards Prysmian $539mn contract for Tunisia-Europe power cable
summary: Italy has awarded Prysmian a contract worth $539 million for a power cable project connecting Tunisia to Europe. The project is part of broader efforts to strengthen energy interconnections.
